label: 垂領
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 56th  . Nara National Museum . 2004
説明文: Garments with V" necks and overlapping front panels, these were among the ceremonial robes worn by men in the Nara period. The term is used in contrast with round-collared garments like the hō. By the Kamakura period (1185-1333) "v" necked robes such as the hitatare, suō and daimon, became standard wear. The kosode and its modern-day variation, the kimono, are also tarikubi garments. [直垂、素襖、大紋] "
